article_text: WASHINGTON (AP) — A Supreme Court justice cleared the way Wednesday for the $860 million merger of Delta Air Lines and Western Airlines, vacating a lower court injunction that would have blocked the merger due to a dispute over union representation. Supreme Court Justice Sandra Day O’Connor approved the application by Western and Delta attorneys to vacate Tuesday’s ruling by a three-judge panel of the 9th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals in San Francisco, said Kathy Arberg, Supreme Court spokeswoman. ‘‘That means the merger can take place,” Arberg said.
article_headline: Court gives OK to airline merger
